Sentencas: Despite several disadvantages with the electronic conduction of ceria, researchers report the high performance of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) at intermediate temperatures with advanced cathode materials.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions

Sentencas: However, it appears the long-term stability of ceria-based SOFCs in the anode-supported cell configuration have still not been proved experimentally at practical operating conditions.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions

Sentencas: In particular, the chemical expansion of ceria electrolytes can cause potentially irreversible failure of SOFCs under large P-O2 gradients.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions

Sentencas: Hence, we investigate the degradation behavior of NiO-Nd0.1Ce0.9O2-delta anode-supported cells with Nd0.1Ce0.9O2-delta electrolyte in dynamic electrical modes, load trip (0.7-0 A cm(-2)), load cycle (0.2-0.12 A cm(-2)), and constant load operation (0.2 A cm(-2)), at 650 degrees C.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions

Sentencas: We identify the specific degradation phenomenon of ceria-based cells by analyzing the electrochemical characteristics in post-mortem investigations after durability testing under various electrical load conditions.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions

Sentencas: Additionally, we suggest a possible operation strategy to mitigate the performance degradation of cells under various electrical stresses through understanding of the main degradation mechanism.
Titulo: Degradation studies of ceria-based solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperature under various load conditions
